name: HighsTimer
brief:
Profiling facility for HiGHS computational components

**HighsTimer Class:**
Wall-clock timing with named clocks for performance profiling.

**Clock Management:**
- clock_def(): Define a named clock, returns clock index
- start()/stop(): Start/stop a clock (asserts proper pairing)
- read(): Get elapsed time (handles running clocks)
- running(): Check if clock is running
- numCall(): Get number of times clock was stopped

**Built-in Clocks:**
- Clock 0: "Run HiGHS" (total time)
- presolve_clock, solve_clock, postsolve_clock: Phase timings

**Reporting:**
- report(): Print timing breakdown for clock list (grep-friendly format)
- reportOnTolerance(): Only report clocks above percentage threshold
- writeAllClocks(): Dump all clock times

**Implementation:**
Uses std::chrono::high_resolution_clock. Clock start stores negative
wall time; positive indicates stopped. This enables running/stopped detection.
